intro: Billardiera floribunda, commonly known as the silver dollar vine, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its trailing habit and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers that are typically borne on long, slender pedicels. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Billardiera floribunda is often cultivated as a ground cover or ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
